SEARCH
Package com.amina.backend.ticket

Class TicketPool

java.lang.Object
com.amina.backend.ticket.TicketPool
public class TicketPool extends Object
Manages the ticketing system, serving as a shared resource for vendors and customers.

The TicketPool class implements concurrency control to ensure thread-safe operations when multiple threads (vendors and customers) interact with the pool.

Since:
2024-12-11
Version:
1.0
Author:
Amina

  • Constructor Details

    • TicketPool

      public TicketPool(int maxTicketCapacity, int totalTickets, ActivityWebSocketHandler webSocketHandler)
      Constructs a TicketPool with specified capacity, total tickets, and WebSocket handler.
      Parameters:
      maxTicketCapacity - The maximum capacity of tickets in the pool.
      totalTickets - The total number of tickets to be sold.
      webSocketHandler - The WebSocket handler for broadcasting real-time updates.

  • Method Details

    • addTicket

      public boolean addTicket(Ticket ticket, int vendorId)
      Adds a ticket to the pool if the maximum capacity and total ticket limits are not exceeded.
      Parameters:
      ticket - The ticket to add.
      vendorId - The ID of the vendor adding the ticket.
      Returns:
      true if the ticket was successfully added, false otherwise.

    • removeTicket

      public Ticket removeTicket(int customerId)
      Removes a ticket from the pool for a customer.

      Updates the total tickets sold and broadcasts the event via WebSocket.

      Parameters:
      customerId - The ID of the customer retrieving the ticket.
      Returns:
      The retrieved ticket, or null if no ticket is available or the system is terminated.

    • stopSystem

      public void stopSystem()
      Marks the system as terminated, preventing further operations.

    • isTerminated

      public boolean isTerminated()
      Checks if the system is terminated based on the total tickets sold and pool state.
      Returns:
      true if the system is terminated, false otherwise.

    • getRemainingTickets

      public int getRemainingTickets()
      Gets the number of tickets remaining in the system.
      Returns:
      The number of tickets remaining.

    • getTotalTicketsSold

      public int getTotalTicketsSold()
      Gets the total number of tickets sold.
      Returns:
      The total tickets sold.

    • getTicketsInPool

      public int getTicketsInPool()
      Gets the number of tickets currently in the pool.
      Returns:
      The number of tickets in the pool.

    • generateSummary

      public String generateSummary(boolean manuallyStopped)
      Generates a summary of the system's state, including the number of tickets sold, tickets remaining, and whether the system was stopped manually or naturally.
      Parameters:
      manuallyStopped - true if the system was manually stopped, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      A summary string.
